this also means though that older phones

you can turn these updates off but I

however one thing that may be slowing
your phone down that you do have some
control over is how many apps you have
installed with storage sizes phone
feature sets and download speeds
increasing it's easy to have dozens or
even hundreds of third-party apps
installed on your phone and not even
realize it having so many apps installed
can slow your phone down in two ways one
certain apps can load up code that runs
in the background when you start up your
phone which can use up processor cycles
and RAM to as the amount of free space
that you have remaining on your device
decreases the solid-state storage inside
your phone slows down because its
operating system has to work harder to
find pieces of free space to write new
data to now although this kind of file
fragmentation isn't nearly as much of a
concern on solid-state phone storage as
it would be with a spinning hard drive
it can still be noticeable and this also
applies if your phone is filled with
things other than apps I mean how many
old videos or photos of where you parked
at the mall do you have in your pocket
that you just never bother deleting so
if your phone is intolerably slow
transferring media to cloud storage and
then removing apps that you don't need
anymore as well as deleting cached data
are good first steps if you're more of

which has led to
creative solutions from companies like
